frameDefinitions: This frame concerns an Evaluee being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked.
A member or members of a Class have just been  mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance  (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.
A Defender responds to an Assailant's attack on a Victim by directly, and usually violently, countering it.
An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.
This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.
This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.
frameExamples: My husband left me for <t>another</t> woman -- and now wants to get back together again!
Samantha stalwartly <t>defended</t> the gateway from the wraiths, crouching low over Stephen's prone form.
Johann's <t><fex name='Experiment'>experiment</fex></t> proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease.
We <t>searched</t> the yard  for my contact lens.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
This role marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
The general category of entity which has been referred to.
The instance of the <fen>Class</fen> that is added to the <fen>Initial_set</fen> of entities in the <fen>Class</fen>.
The previously mentioned group of entities of the <fen>Class</fen>.
This role is the being or entity that responds forcefully to the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The individual or entity that is under attack from the <fen>Assailant</fen> .
This role identifies the time when the Defender takes forceful action against the Assailant.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Defender</fen> defends the <fen>Victim</fen> from the <fen>Assailant</fen>.
The <fen>Experimenter</fen> is the individual conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The group of entities in the <fen>Experiment</fen> which have not been treated and are compared to the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
An individual entity of the <fen>Experiment</fen> which is left untreated and then compared with the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or the <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fex name='Controlled_individual'>Controlled_individuals</fex>.
An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Controlled_individual</fen>.
The test or <fen>Experiment</fen> conducted by the <fen>Experimenter</fen> using a <fen>Control_group</fen> and a <fen>Treatment_group</fen>.
The <fen>Hypothesis</fen> is a conjecture as to the result of an <fen>Experiment</fen>.  The <fen>Experiment</fen> takes place in order to prove the <fen>Hypothesis</fen> as correct or incorrect.

In this frame <fen>Control_group</fen> and <fen>Treatment_group</fen> can be combined and expressed as <fen>Subjects</fen>.  This role can also be used for a generic individual on whom the <fen>Experiment</fen> is being conducted (see second example).
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject that the <fen>Experiment</fen> is studying.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experimenter</fen> conducts the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Experiment</fen> is conducted.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This role can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:
An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>  that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is scrutinizing the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> performs some action in order to have a perceptual experience. It is expressed as an External Argument:

<fen>Phenomenon</fen> indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience. Typically, it is expressed as an Object with verbs.
<fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the part of the body used as a sensory organ of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen>, typically expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.

<fen>Direction</fen> is used for all path-like expressions that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception, with the exception of those indicating the location of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> (which would be marked <fen>Location_of_perceiver</fen>)
When the activity of attempting to perceive occurs.
The general location within which the act of perception takes place.
listRoleExamples: The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex>in freshness</fex>.
My Husband left me for another <fex>man</fex>!
A further five incursions <fex>over and above those noted for 1995</fex> took place in the first three months of 1996.
<fex>Justin's</fex> experiment turned out to be rather successful.
<fex>One rat's</fex> treatment caused it to outlive the rats of the control group.
They were hoping to conduct an experiment <fex>on the albino rats</fex>.
Jimmy conducted an experiment <fex>on tropical plants in non-tropical environments</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> examined the case for free speech.
The temperature controller monitored the temperature <fex>with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.
<fex>The waiter</fex> smelled the milk to see if it was fresh.
The waiter smelled <fex>the milk</fex> to see if it was fresh.
You should feel the water <fex>with your toes</fex> before jumping in.
The detective looked <fex>across the street</fex> at the suspect.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: National Institute for Health Research and Social Care
